org.orgName: Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction in Kentucky

body.p: Office created in 1838 to advocate and oversee the development of public education in Kentucky. Established as an official state position by an act of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky on February 10, 1845. Civil War-era superintendents: Joseph James Bullock (1838-1839); Hubbard Hinde Kavanaugh (1839-1840); Benjamin Bosworth Smith (1840-1842); George W. Brush (1842-1843); Ryland Thompson Dillard (1843-1847); Robert Jefferson Breckinridge (1847-1853); John Daniel Matthews (1853-1859); Robert Carter Richardson (1859-1863); Daniel Stevenson (1863-1867).
